title: 7. Your production Compute workloads are running in a subnet with a range 192.168.20.128/25. A recent surge in traffic has seen the production VMs struggle, and you want to add more VMs, but there are no free IP addresses in the VPC. All new and old VMs need to communicate with each other. How can you do this with the fewest steps?
alternatives: A. Create a new VPC and a new subnet with IP range 192.168.21.0/24. Enable VPC Peering between the old VPC and new VPC. Configure a custom Route exchange.
B. Create a new VPC network and a new subnet with IP range 192.168.21.0/24. Enable VPC Peering between the old VPC and new VPC.
C. Create a new non-overlapping Alias range in the existing VPC and Configure the VMs to use the alias range.
D. Update the subnet range to 192.168.20.0/24.
